P045600.project_name: States' Road Infrastructure Development Technical Assistance Project

keywords.cdata: account,accountability,Accounting,Accounts,acquisition,Audits,budgetary allocation,budgeting,business management,capital costs,central government,Competitive Bidding,consulting services,contractors,decision-making,Executing Agencies,execution,expenditure,expenditures,financial assistance,financial constraints,financial reform,FISCAL,foreign exchange,Impact assessment,institutional arrangements,institutional development,institutional framework,institutional reforms,levies,Ministry of Finance,performance accountability,private sector,private sector investment,Procurement,programs,Provisions,public funding,Public Information,Public Works,quality control,Rehabilitation,reporting,representatives,revenue sources,roads,social sciences,state authorities,State budget,State Government,tax,tax liabilities,Technical Assistance,training initiatives,utilities

project_abstract.cdata: The overall objective of the States' Road Infrastructure Development Technical Assistance Project is to strengthen policy based efforts by individual States towards effective reforms in the provision, financing and maintenance of road infrastructure, while assisting their preparation of high-priority quality road infrastructure investments aimed at Bank financing. The project will, over five years, finance technical assistance activities in three project components: a) project preparation and implementation support; b) policy support and institutional development; and c) project management.
